page.title: 17THE CHURCH
page.content: Lismore's beautifully kept{Church is the{choir}of a{cathedral}built in the {13th}century. Its history goes back to {562}when{Saint Moluag}came from {Ireland}and used{Lismore}as a{base from which to bring{Christianity}to large parts of Scotland, including {Aberdeenshire.}Lismore was a centre of worship for centuries, with a{Bishop's {Palace.}Appin, Benderloch and Kingairloch were part of its parish. The Church now flourishes in the {Church of Scotland,}with a young minister based on Appin but with a{new {manse}in Lismore. There are{60 members,{7}kindly{elders,}a most active{Women's Guild,}a{Sunday School and a{Bible Study Group. The{oldest church relic}in Scotland, the{pastoral staff 0f St. Moluag,}is kept at{Bachuil}by the{descendant of the Saint's{staff bearer.
